Is it a Michael Moore'esque parody?

 If you're thinking of a specific movie, you're probably thinking of "An American Carol".
 An American Carol (2008)
 
 Regarding Religulous, I was impressed with Maher's "restraint" in that he wasn't as offensive as he typically is on the subject. His end-rant was heavy-handed and over the top (IMO), but a lot of his preceding criticism went to the facts without being too overtly insulting.
 
 I think he's got a pretty impressive point regarding the "Mormon" and "Scientology" beliefs and how they are viewed, as compared to other "more accepted" beliefs like Christianity which believe things that are comparatively absurd yet overlooked.
I'm sorry that Maher forgot to mention the Moonies, who are pretty tight with the Republican party.

I found it to be rather silly, frankly.
 
 The list of ostensible pagan parallels (Mithras, etc.) was particularly laughable. If Maher was as thoughtful as he tries to present himself, he and his crew would have taken the time to do a little research.
